repnme.cdata!:
Mauritania - Transport Sector Institutional
            Development and Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Transport Sector
            Institutional Development and Technical Assistance Project
            for Mauritania were as follows outcomes were satisfactory;
            risk to development outcome was moderate; bank performance
            was satisfactory; borrower performance was satisfactory.
            There are some of the key lessons learned from this project:
            (i) early identification of reform champions within
            government structures; (ii) realistic project objectives;
            (iii) setting up adequate structures to ensure both momentum
            and sustainability of reform agenda;(iv) strong government
            ownership of reform agenda in the transport sector;(v)
            strong cooperation with European Union /development partners
            to ensure alignment and synergies in the transport sector;
            (vi) adequate implementation time frame for all activities
            to absorb `force majeure` events; (vii) when conditions are
            right, standalone ta loans should be considered to modernize
            / reform the transport sector before engaging in major
            investment lending. The project development objective as
            stated in the Project Appraisal Document (PAD) was to
            improve land, maritime, and air transport sector management.
            The project also sought to strengthen the sector
            coordination capacity of the Ministry of Equipment and
            Transport (MET) in order to achieve greater efficiency and
            effectiveness of Mauritanian transport sector
